intro: Dodecatheon angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved glory-of-the-snow, is a member of the Primulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States, typically found in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, which bloom in early spring. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged opposite along the stem, contributing to its delicate appearance. The plant thrives in well-drained, loamy soils and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
